function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited understanding of intra-and inter-person variability in the magnitude of virus excretion/shedding.","Impact":"Difficulty in determining if infections are from a few super-shedders or from a large portion of the population.","Mitigation":"Conduct extensive studies to determine variability in virus excretion and shedding across individuals and the general population.","Technologies":"Advanced biometric tracking technologies, PCR testing, and sewage analysis techniques.","People":"Public health officials, researchers, and wastewater treatment professionals.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Uncertainty regarding the excretion-route distribution of virus markers (e.g., fecal versus urine) and unknown importance for different markers.","Impact":"Challenges in targeting the right markers and understanding the transmission routes of the virus through wastewater.","Mitigation":"Conduct in-depth studies to determine excretion-route distribution and the importance of different markers in wastewater.","Technologies":"Advanced molecular biology techniques, wastewater analysis, and antigen testing methods.","People":"Public health officials, researchers, and wastewater treatment professionals.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Lack of knowledge about the half-life (persistence) of virus markers in wastewater and its impact on sampling methods and measurement accuracy.","Impact":"Risk of using trailing measures of infection if the half-life of markers is too long, leading to inaccurate assessments of infection levels.","Mitigation":"Conduct research to determine the half-life of virus markers in wastewater and how temperature influences their persistence.","Technologies":"Environmental monitoring technologies, advanced chemical analysis techniques, and temperature-controlled wastewater systems.","People":"Public health officials, researchers, and wastewater treatment professionals.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions, and government agencies."}]}
